DataElement.preferredDefinition: the indicator that asks whether the patient had a negative serum or urine pregnancy test.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to a negative pregnancy test for a patient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Negative; involving disadvantage or harm.:Tests to determine whether or not an individual is pregnant.

Concepts.definition: Tests to determine whether or not an individual is pregnant.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the indicator that asks whether the patient had a negative serum or urine pregnancy test.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.origin: ACOSOG CRF:American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Case Report Form

ReferenceDocuments.name: Women of child-bearing potent
ReferenceDocuments.description: Women of child-bearing potential must have negative serum or urine pregnancy test

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Negative serum pregnancy test done <= 7 days prior to registration, for women of childbearing potential only.  If not a women of childbearing potential or male (check NA)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description:
Non-pregnant and non-lactating, as confirmed by pre-treatment pregnancy test for patients of childbearing
potential.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Negative pregnancy test done <=7 days prior to registration, for women of childbearing potential only.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Non-pregnant and non-breast-feeding

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Non-pregnant and non-lactating

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Non-pregnant and non-lactating.  Women of reproductive age must be willing to use contraception during study therapy.  If not a woman of reproductive age (or male) (check NA)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Women of child-bearing potential must have a negative urine or serum pregnancy test within 2 weeks of registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Non-pregnant and non-lactating.  Women of childbearing potential must have a negative urine or serum pregnancy test within 60 days prior to registration.  Peri-menopausal women must be amenorrheic >= 12 months prior to registration to be considered not of childbearing potential.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Negative urine or serum pregnancy test done <=7 days prior to randomization, for women of childbearing potential only

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Negative serum or urine pregnancy test done <=14 days prior to registration, for women of childbearing potential only. If not a woman of childbearing potential or male (check NA)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Negative pregnancy test done <=7 days prior to registration, for women of childbearing potential only. If not a woman of childbearing potential or male (check NA)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Negative pregnancy test within 48 hours prior to initiation of protocol therapy, for women of childbearing potential only. If not a woman of childbearing potential or male (check NA)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Females of childbearing potential must have a negative pregnancy test within 48 hours prior to initiation of protocol therapy. If not a woman of childbearing potential, please check N/A

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Females of childbearing potential must have a negative pregnancy test within 7 days prior to initiation of protocol therapy. If not a woman of childbearing potential, please check N/A.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Females of childbearing potential must have a negative urine or serum pregnancy test within 72 hours prior to receiving the first dose of study medication.  If not a woman of childbearing potential or male, please check N/A.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN
ReferenceDocuments.description: Negative urine or serum pregnancy test prior to enrollment. If not a woman with reproductive potential or a male, please check N/A.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: If of child-bearing potential, was a negative serum or urine pregnancy test obtained?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ALT - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If of child-bearing potential, was a negative serum or urine pregnancy test obtained within 2 weeks prior to registration to rule out pregnancy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ALT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If of child-bearing potential, was a negative serum or urine pregnancy test obtained within 2 weeks prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ALT 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If of child-bearing potential, was a negative serum or urine pregnancy test obtained within 28 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1501 Question
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient is a woman of childbearing potential, has the patient agreed to have a negative serum pregnancy test within 24 hours prior to treatment start? Â

ReferenceDocuments.name: EAI142 Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is a female of childbearing potential, was a blood test or urine study within 7 days prior to FES PET/CT scan and FDG PET/CT scan to rule out pregnancy obtained?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Female patients of childbearing potential must have a negative urine or serum pregnancy test within 72 hours before receiving the first dose of study medication. If not a woman of childbearing potential, or a male, please check N/A.

ReferenceDocuments.name: 14 days
ReferenceDocuments.description: For females of child-bearing potential, negative serum pregnancy test within 14 days of enrollment.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN-2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Females of childbearing potential must have a negative urine or serum pregnancy test within 72 hours before receiving the first dose of study medication for retreatment. If not a woman of childbearing potential or a male, please check N/A

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text12
ReferenceDocuments.description: was there a Negative pregnancy test <= 7 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF 1801 v3
ReferenceDocuments.description: For females of child-bearing potential, negative serum or urine pregnancy test within 14 days of enrollment.

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Negative serum or urine pregnancy test within 14 days of randomization for women of child-bearing potential.

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a serum or urine pregnancy test within 14 days prior to registration?

DataElement.origin: ACOSOG CRF:American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Case Report Form
